p: These mood scales have been utilised in numerous pharmacological, psychopharmacological and medical trials. These scales comprise a total of sixteen 100 mm lines anchored at either end by antonyms (e.g., “alert-drowsy,” “calm-excited”). Participants indicate their current subjective position between the antonyms on the line. Outcomes comprise three factor analysis derived scores: “Alertness”, “Calmness” and “Contentment”.
